explanation: The report is correct for the configuration described. If neither HAVE_SCHED_GETAFFINITY nor HAVE_GETPID is defined, the entire #if ... #endif region is removed by the preprocessor. That leaves ret initialized to -1 and never modified, so the test if (0 >= ret) is always true and the subsequent return ret; can never be reached. That is unreachable code and therefore violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 in that build configuration. (If those macros are defined in some build configurations that are part of the project then the code may be reachable in those builds; the violation applies for the specific configuration where the macros are not defined.)
